p: As a common type of upper gastrointestinal disorder, gastric ulcers are induced by an imbalance between aggressive factors (such as hydrochloric acid (HCl) and pepsin secretion) and protective factors (such as prostaglandins, mucus production, antioxidants, and adequate blood flow) [ 1]. The onset of gastric ulcers is related to not only genetic factors but also environmental factors, such as unhealthy lifestyle (such as excessive alcohol consumption, smoking, and excessive salt intake) and Helicobacter pylori infection [ 2].
